nodes.title: Axios
nodes.desc: A popular JavaScript library for making HTTP requests in Node.js and web browsers, providing a simple and intuitive API for sending HTTP requests. [axios](https://axios-http.com/)

nodes.title: HTTP Requests
nodes.desc: Axios supports various HTTP request methods, including GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and more, allowing for flexible communication with servers. [MDN Web Docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest)

nodes.title: Cancel Requests
nodes.desc: Axios allows for canceling ongoing requests, providing more control over the request lifecycle. [axios](https://axios-http.com/docs/cancellation)

nodes.title: Progress Tracking
nodes.desc: Axios supports progress tracking for uploads and downloads, enabling features like progress bars. [axios](https://axios-http.com/docs/req_config#onUploadProgress)

nodes.title: Automatic Transforms
nodes.desc: Axios can automatically transform request and response data using built-in or custom transforms. [axios](https://axios-http.com/docs/req_config#transformRequest)

nodes.title: Promise-based API
nodes.desc: Axios uses Promises to handle asynchronous requests, making it easier to write and manage complex code. [MDN Web Docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise)

nodes.title: Interceptors
nodes.desc: Axios provides a built-in interceptor system for modifying requests and responses globally or locally, enabling features like authentication and caching. [axios](https://axios-http.com/docs/interceptors)

nodes.title: JSON Data Format
nodes.desc: Axios automatically converts JSON data to JavaScript objects and vice versa, simplifying data exchange between client and server. [JSON](https://www.json.org/)

nodes.title: Browser Support
nodes.desc: Axios supports a wide range of browsers, including older versions, ensuring compatibility and reliability. [Can I Use](https://caniuse.com/)

nodes.title: Node.js Support
nodes.desc: Axios can be used in Node.js environments, allowing for seamless communication with servers and APIs. [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/)

nodes.title: Security Features
nodes.desc: Axios includes security features like protection against XSRF attacks and support for HTTPS. [OWASP](https://owasp.org/)

nodes.title: Community Support
nodes.desc: Axios has an active community and a wide range of resources, including documentation, tutorials, and examples. [GitHub](https://github.com/axios/axios)

nodes.title: Error Handling
nodes.desc: Axios provides robust error handling mechanisms, enabling developers to catch and handle errors efficiently. [MDN Web Docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error)
